  
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en" dir="ltr" prefix="content: http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/  dc: http://purl.org/dc/terms/  foaf: http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/  og: http://ogp.me/ns#  rdfs: http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#  schema: http://schema.org/  sioc: http://rdfs.org/sioc/ns#  sioct: http://rdfs.org/sioc/types#  skos: http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#  xsd: http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema# " class="no-js">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8" />
<meta name="description" content="We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH." />
<meta name="abstract" content="We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH." />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://cepr.org/publications/dp21094" />
<meta property="og:site_name" content="CEPR" />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://cepr.org/publications/dp21094" />
<meta property="og:title" content="DP21094 Younger Firms and CEOs Allow More Work from Home" />
<meta property="og:description" content="We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH." />
<meta property="og:image:url" content="https://cepr.org/themes/cepr/assets/img/default-social-share.png" />
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
<meta name="twitter:description" content="We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH." />
<meta name="twitter:title" content="DP21094 Younger Firms and CEOs Allow More Work from Home" />
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://cepr.org,https://cepr.org/themes/nhsc-shared/nhsc_base/assets/img/default-social-share.png" />

                      </li>

                  <a href="/audio-and-video/webinar-videos" data-drupal-link-system-path="node/422590">Webinar Videos</a>
        
        
                      </li>
      </ul>

      </div>
    </div>
  
              </li>
          
                                  
            <li class="c-main-menu__menu-item">
                  <a href="/about" class="c-main-menu__item-link o-menu-item-link" data-drupal-link-system-path="node/1">About CEPR</a>
        
                  <button class="c-main-menu__expand-sub-nav js-sub-menu-toggle">

          </button>
        
                            
                
      <div class="c-main-menu__sub-nav-wrapper o-mega-menu">
    <div class="c-main-menu__sub-nav-container o-container">
  
  <ul class="c-main-menu__sub-nav o-mega-menu__list menu-level-1">
        
          
                                  
            <li class="c-main-menu__sub-nav-list-item o-mega-menu__list-item">

<main id="content">
    <a id="main-content" tabindex="-1"></a>

      <div class="region region-content">
      






















  <div class="c-breadcrumbs">
    <nav class="c-breadcrumbs__inner o-container" aria-label="Breadcrumb navigation">
        <ol class="c-breadcrumbs__list">
          <li class="c-breadcrumbs__item">
        <span class="c-breadcrumbs__crumb-divider">/</span>
                  <a href="/publications" class="c-breadcrumbs__link">Publications</a>
              </li>
          <li class="c-breadcrumbs__item">
        <span class="c-breadcrumbs__crumb-divider">/</span>
                  <a href="/publications/discussion-papers" class="c-breadcrumbs__link">Discussion Papers</a>
              </li>
      </ol>

    </nav>
  </div>





    
    
            
  <header
    class="c-single-header c-single-header--publication c-single-header--with-border c-single-header--no-image">
    <article class="c-single-header__container o-container">
            
              


                                                                                                                  

  
<div class="c-single-header__inner c-single-header__inner--with-margin">
  
  <div class="c-single-header__content-wrapper">
    <div class="c-single-header__tag-wrapper">
      <span>Discussion paper</span>
          </div>

    
    <h1 class="c-single-header__heading">DP21094 Younger Firms and CEOs Allow More Work from Home</h1>

          <ul class="c-single-header__meta-wrapper">
                  <li class="c-single-header__meta-data">
                          <a href="/about/people/cevat-giray-aksoy-1">Cevat Giray Aksoy</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/jose-maria-barrero">Jose Maria Barrero</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/nicholas-bloom">Nicholas Bloom</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/katelyn-cranney">Katelyn Cranney</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/steven-davis">Steven Davis</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/mathias-dolls">Mathias Dolls</a>
                          <a href="/about/people/pablo-zarate">Pablo Zarate</a>
                      </li>
        
              </ul>
    
          <ul class="c-single-header__meta-wrapper">
              <time class="c-single-header__meta-data" datetime="28 Jan 2026">Published: 28 Jan 2026</time>
                  </ul>
    
          <p class="c-single-header__summary">  We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH.
</p>
    
          <div class="c-single-header__add-to-cart-wrapper">
                      <form class="commerce-order-item-add-to-cart-form-commerce-product-21949 commerce-order-item-add-to-cart-form" data-drupal-selector="commerce-order-item-add-to-cart-form-commerce-product-21949" action="/publications/dp21094" method="post" id="commerce-order-item-add-to-cart-form-commerce-product-21949" accept-charset="UTF-8" novalidate>
        
  
    <input autocomplete="off" data-drupal-selector="form-x-29-ncwv7fkcmjq-iusb-cnbzeze4z7xhdqe-kekna" type="hidden" name="form_build_id" value="form-x-29_NcwV7fkCmJQ-iuSb_cnbzEZE4Z7Xhdqe-KeKNA" />
        <input data-drupal-selector="edit-commerce-order-item-add-to-cart-form-commerce-product-21949" type="hidden" name="form_id" value="commerce_order_item_add_to_cart_form_commerce_product_21949" />
        <input class="button--add-to-cart o-button c-single-header__add-to-cart-button button button--primary js-form-submit form-submit" data-drupal-selector="edit-submit" type="submit" id="edit-submit" name="op" value="Add to basket" />
    

</form>



                      <span class="c-single-header__price">£6.00</span>
                        </div>
    
          <div class="c-single-header__meta-block o-meta-block">
        <div class="c-single-header__meta-block-content-wrapper">
          <div class="c-single-header__meta-block-title-tag">
            <h6 class="c-single-header__meta-block-tag">Citation</h6>

            <p class="c-single-header__meta-block-text js-citation-text" id="citation-text">Aksoy, C, J Barrero, N Bloom, K Cranney, S Davis, M Dolls and P Zarate (2026), ‘DP21094 Younger Firms and CEOs Allow More Work from Home‘, CEPR Discussion Paper No. 21094. CEPR Press, Paris &amp; London. <a href="https://cepr.org/publications/dp21094" hreflang="en">https://cepr.org/publications/dp21094</a></p>
          </div>

          <button class="c-single-header__meta-block-button js-citation-button" data-clipboard-target="#citation-text">
            <span class="u-accessible-hide">Copy citation to clipboard</span>

            <span class="c-single-header__meta-block-icon o-icon-link">

  <use class="o-svg__use" xlink:href="/themes/custom/cepr/assets/img/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=14#copy"/>
</svg>
            </span>

            <span class="c-single-header__meta-block-icon-tick o-icon-link js-citation-feedback">
              
<svg class="o-svg o-svg--tick">
        
  <use class="o-svg__use" xlink:href="/themes/custom/cepr/assets/img/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=14#tick"/>
</svg>
            </span>
          </button>

             target="_blank"
             title="Share via Twitter">

            <span class="u-accessible-hide">Twitter</span>

              <li class="c-share-links__list-item">
          <a class="o-icon-link js-social-share"
             href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcepr.org%2Fpublications%2Fdp21094"
             target="_blank"
             title="Share via Facebook">
            
<svg class="o-svg o-svg--facebook c-share-links__icon c-share-links__icon--facebook">
        
  <use class="o-svg__use" xlink:href="/themes/custom/cepr/assets/img/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=14#facebook"/>
</svg>

            <span class="u-accessible-hide">Facebook</span>
          </a>
        </li>
              <li class="c-share-links__list-item">
          <a class="o-icon-link js-social-share"
             href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fcepr.org%2Fpublications%2Fdp21094&amp;title=DP21094%20Younger%20Firms%20and%20CEOs%20Allow%20More%20Work%20from%20Home&amp;source=CEPR&amp;summary=We establish three facts about work from home (WFH) in the United States. First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH."
             target="_blank"
             title="Share via LinkedIn">
            
<svg class="o-svg o-svg--linkedin c-share-links__icon c-share-links__icon--linkedin">
        
  <use class="o-svg__use" xlink:href="/themes/custom/cepr/assets/img/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=14#linkedin"/>
</svg>

            <span class="u-accessible-hide">LinkedIn</span>
          </a>
        </li>
          </ul>

      </div>

    </article>
  </header>

First, employees WFH more often at younger firms – almost twice as often at firms founded after 2015 than at firms founded before 1990. Second, employees working under younger CEOs have higher levels of WFH. The average WFH rate is 1.4 days per week when the CEO is under 30, compared to 1.1 days when the CEO is 60 or older. Third, the self-employed WFH more than twice as often as wage-and-salary employees. These facts highlight the importance of organizational and managerial attributes for the prevalence of WFH."

      <h3 class="c-card__title">

<article data-history-node-id="446545" role="article" about="/voxeu/columns/vignette-study-work-home-and-attitudes-household-work" class="c-card c-card--vox_article c-card--fc_3r_img">
    

  
  <a class="c-card__image-wrapper " href="/voxeu/columns/vignette-study-work-home-and-attitudes-household-work"
     title="A vignette study of work from home and attitudes to household work" tabindex="-1">
    <div
      class="c-card__image-inner  c-card__image-inner--has-image ">
      <div class="c-media c-media--image c-media--_6-9-no-pop-up">
  
            <picture>
                  <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_small/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.webp?itok=vOBvIdF2 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 480px)" type="image/webp" width="560" height="315"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_small/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.webp?itok=vOBvIdF2 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/webp" width="560" height="315"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_standard/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.webp?itok=wjFmff71 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 1017px)" type="image/webp" width="1136" height="639"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_standard/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.webp?itok=wjFmff71 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 1275px)" type="image/webp" width="1136" height="639"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_large/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.webp?itok=qjqAVXTO 1x" media="only screen and (min-width: 1276px)" type="image/webp" width="2272" height="1278"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_small/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.jpeg?itok=vOBvIdF2 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 480px)" type="image/jpeg" width="560" height="315"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_small/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.jpeg?itok=vOBvIdF2 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="560" height="315"/>

              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_standard/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.jpeg?itok=wjFmff71 1x" media="only screen and (max-width: 1275px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1136" height="639"/>
              <source srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_large/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.jpeg?itok=qjqAVXTO 1x" media="only screen and (min-width: 1276px)" type="image/jpeg" width="2272" height="1278"/>
                  <img loading="eager" class="c-media__image" src="/sites/default/files/styles/16_9_small/public/2025-12/AdobeStock_585936948.jpeg?itok=vOBvIdF2" width="560" height="315" alt="Woman working on laptop and man vacuuming" typeof="foaf:Image" />

  </picture>



  </div>


                </div>

      </a>

<div class="c-card__content-wrapper">
      <div class="c-card__sub-type-wrapper is-black">
      <small class="c-card__sub-type"><span class="is-voxeu-text">VoxEU</span> Column</small>
    </div>
  
    
      <h3 class="c-card__title">
      <a class="c-card__title-link" href="/voxeu/columns/vignette-study-work-home-and-attitudes-household-work">A vignette study of work from home and attitudes to household work</a>
    </h3>
  
    
    
        <ul class="c-card__meta-wrapper">
              <li class="c-card__meta-text c-card__meta-text--list-item">
          <a class="c-card__meta-text--link" href="/about/people/andreas-kotsadam">Andreas Kotsadam</a>
        </li>
              <li class="c-card__meta-text c-card__meta-text--list-item">
          <a class="c-card__meta-text--link" href="/about/people/mette-lovgren">Mette Løvgren</a>
        </li>
              <li class="c-card__meta-text c-card__meta-text--list-item">
          <a class="c-card__meta-text--link" href="/about/people/nicolas-moreau">Nicolas Moreau</a>
        </li>
              <li class="c-card__meta-text c-card__meta-text--list-item">
          <a class="c-card__meta-text--link" href="/about/people/elena-stancanelli">Elena Stancanelli</a>
        </li>
              <li class="c-card__meta-text c-card__meta-text--list-item">
          <a class="c-card__meta-text--link" href="/about/people/arthur-van-soest">Arthur van Soest</a>
        </li>
          </ul>
  
  
          
        <div class="c-card__theme-wrapper">

                    <div class="c-card__taxonomy-wrapper">
          
                      <time class="c-card__extra-meta" datetime="2 Jan 2026">
              2 Jan 2026
            </time>
          
                                <ul class="c-card__taxonomy-list">
                                                                        
                                              ![](../../../../../../../../../../var/folders/34/zq18d8kx7kbgby0j06p_j6t40000gn/T/TemporaryItems/NSIRD_screencaptureui_EM2XPo/Screenshot 2022-01-04 at 17.01.16.png)

                <li class="c-card__taxonomy-list-item c-card__taxonomy-list-item--themes">
                  <a class="c-card__taxonomy-list-link" href="/themes/gender"
                     title="Go to the Gender page">Gender</a>
                </li>
                                              ![](../../../../../../../../../../var/folders/34/zq18d8kx7kbgby0j06p_j6t40000gn/T/TemporaryItems/NSIRD_screencaptureui_EM2XPo/Screenshot 2022-01-04 at 17.01.16.png)

                <li class="c-card__taxonomy-list-item c-card__taxonomy-list-item--themes">
                  <a class="c-card__taxonomy-list-link" href="/themes/labour-markets"
                     title="Go to the Labour Markets page">Labour Markets</a>
                </li>
                          </ul>

                                          </div>
      
                      </div>
  

  
            
    </div>
</article>

              </div>
    </div>
  </section>

  


    <div class="u-clear"></div>
  </div>

</main>
